{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3378446,"name":"donald","username":"username2","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/username2/{size}/226385_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-02T01:30:52.465Z","cooked":"

So on the robot my team made back in 2023 we powered the compressor off the pdh after we blew a couple fuses and an inspector told us to do that. Where is that legal, and how does it work? The pneumatics hub still is connected to the solenoids and the limit switch.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-05-02T01:30:52.465Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":18,"reads":293,"readers_count":292,"score":153.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":465118,"topic_slug":"compresser-powered-by-pdh","display_username":"donald","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66477,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/compresser-powered-by-pdh/465118/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3378532,"name":"","username":"EHutson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ehutson/{size}/177423_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-02T02:46:16.597Z","cooked":"

This is not legal, the compressor has to be powered either through the pneumatics hub REV or the pneumatics control module CTRE. If an inspector told you to do it another way that is wrong. If the compressor is connected straight to the PDH then it will have no way of turning off. See rule R504

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-05-02T02:47:51.626Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":277,"readers_count":276,"score":60.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":465118,"topic_slug":"compresser-powered-by-pdh","display_username":"","primary_group_name":"FUN","flair_name":"FUN","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/3/5/3523e759b0af37a7757142a8b2aa79b31f1a47c4.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":60,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51376,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FUN"},"post_url":"/t/compresser-powered-by-pdh/465118/2","custom_user_title":"FUN","reactions":[{"id":"-1","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3378544,"name":"Joshua J","username":"thatnameistaken","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/57b2e6/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-05-02T03:17:42.869Z","cooked":"

Youâ€™d use a legal relay (Spike or Automation Direct, see R504) in between the compressor and PDH. Someone can correct me on this, but I believe WPILib no longer maintains direct support for this; the easiest way to program it would be to create a relay object in addition to the Compressor object, and periodically poll the compressorâ€™s isEnabled() method, setting the relay on when true and off when false.

Alternatively, if youâ€™re using the digital pressure switch, you could wire that to the RIO directly and avoid creating the compressor object altogether (reading the DIO channel you wired it to instead of the compressor enabled state).

EHutson:

the compressor has to be powered either through the pneumatics hub REV or the pneumatics control module CTRE.

Not quite, see R505. And per R805 and R812, the PCM/PH are actually optional entirely.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-05-02T03:21:18.463Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":251,"readers_count":250,"score":85.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":465118,"topic_slug":"compresser-powered-by-pdh","display_username":"Joshua J","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19116,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"CSA | Drive Coach (2191)"},"post_url":"/t/compresser-powered-by-pdh/465118/3","custom_user_title":"CSA | Drive Coach (2191)","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3378610,"name":"","username":"person4268","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/22d042/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-05-02T05:41:33.974Z","cooked":"

Our team just connected the compressor to an Automation Direct relay and used the compressor output on the PH to switch the relay in 2023. Seems a bit simpler to implement than having to deal with code to me.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-05-02T05:41:33.974Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":195,"readers_count":194,"score":44.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":465118,"topic_slug":"compresser-powered-by-pdh","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":19116,"username":"thatnameistaken","name":"Joshua J","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/57b2e6/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55016,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/compresser-powered-by-pdh/465118/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3378822,"name":"Joshua J","username":"thatnameistaken","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/57b2e6/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-05-02T16:23:20.717Z","cooked":"

Iâ€™m not directly familiar with the Automation Direct relay, but if it can accept 12V as the control voltage, that seems like an easy solution to me.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-05-02T16:23:20.717Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":126,"readers_count":125,"score":25.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":465118,"topic_slug":"compresser-powered-by-pdh","display_username":"Joshua J","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":55016,"username":"person4268","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/22d042/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19116,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"CSA | Drive Coach (2191)"},"post_url":"/t/compresser-powered-by-pdh/465118/5","custom_user_title":"CSA | Drive Coach (2191)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3378962,"name":"Nathan Zhou","username":"NathanZhou","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathanzhou/{size}/225374_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-02T19:10:18.489Z","cooked":"

Per

R812 *Pressure switch requirements.

A. Nason P/N SM-2B-115R/443 (wired as described) and/or
The 2 wires from the pressure switch must be connected directly to the pressure switch input of
the PCM/PH controlling the compressor or, if controlled using the roboRIO and a relay, to the
roboRIO. If connected to the roboRIO, the roboRIO must be programmed to sense the state of
the switch and operate the relay module that powers the compressor to prevent over-pressuring
the system.

and

R505 (table ignored)

and

R805 *If using pneumatics, these parts are required.

Which donâ€™t include PCM or PH

Yes, you can power the entire pneumatic system including the compressor without using PCM or PH.

However, keep in mind,
Per

R504 *Power (most) actuators off of approved devices. B. relay modules,

a. Spike H-Bridge Relay (P/N 217-0220 and SPIKE-RELAY-H),
b. Automation Direct Relay (P/N AD-SSR6M12-DC-200D, AD-SSRM6M25-DC-200D, ADSSR6M40-DC-200D), and
c. Power Distribution Hub (PDH) switched channel (P/N REV-11-1850) for controlling nonactuator CUSTOM CIRCUITS only,

You must using these legal relay to power your compressor and solenoid if youâ€™re not using PCM or PH. Also You must use one dedicated circuit breaker on PDP or PDH instread of VRM/PCM power slot for the compressor per

R621 *Protect circuits with appropriate circuit breakers

Which means if you have enough motor that take all slots on PDP, this could be a problem.

also per

R812 *Pressure switch requirements.

You must be using Nason P/N SM-2B-115R/443, NOT REV Robotics P/N REV-11-1107 analog pressure sensor as it can only be connected to REV PH.

No matter how you program your robot, it must ensure the compressor stop when the pressure switch is not connected or reach itâ€™s target pressure. per R812. During the inspection, they will verify this by having the robot enabled and observe weather the compressor stop at the target pressure or not.

If youâ€™re not running solenoid with PCM or PH, I believe per

R621 *Protect circuits with appropriate circuit breakers.

You would be needing one PDP channel for each relay. So if youâ€™re running say 5 independent solenoid channel, you would be needing 3 relay which will take 3 dedicated channel on PDP. However per

R505 *Donâ€™t overload controllers

Youâ€™re allowed to run multiple solenoid under one relay, itâ€™s just those solenoid would be actuating at the same time.

When wiring the relay module, it MUST be connected to roboRIO relay port NOT DIO per

R712 *Control PWM controllers from the roboRIO.

Every relay module (per R504-B), servo controller, andPWM motor controller shall be connected to a corresponding port (relays to Relay ports, servo controllers and PWM controllers to PWM ports) on the roboRIO (either directly or through a WCP
Spartan Sensor Board) or via a legal MXP connection (per R713). They shall not be controlled by
signals from any other source, with the exception of the Nidec Dynamo motor controller which must also be connected to the roboRIO Digital I/O.

There are only 4 relay port on roboRIO so be considerate. If youâ€™re running pneumatic system without PH pr PCM, you would be basically using 1 relay channel for the compressor, with 3 remaining channel for 3 solenoid. If you do ended up running 3 solenoid setup, 4 channel on PDP will be taken by relay (1 for compressor and 3 for solenoid) and this is probably the max legal amount of solenoid you could run without PCM. and your solenoid valve has to be 12V not 24V.

If you are using SPIKE relay (which i donâ€™t think you could buy as itâ€™s discountinued), be very careful to NOT reverse polarity on your compressor.

Maybe better run solenoid with PCM or PH taken into the space and cost of relay. SPIKE relay is discountinued and currently all automation direct relay legal for FRC is out of stock and unorderable as for May 2024.

In conclusion and for clarification, you could have (FRC Legal) relay running the compressor and PCM running solenoid. You must program your robot no matter how the pressure switch is wired (to roboRIO or PCM) so that the pressure switch trigger compressor shutdown when not connected or reached target pressure.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-05-02T19:34:46.005Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":88,"readers_count":87,"score":22.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":465118,"topic_slug":"compresser-powered-by-pdh","display_username":"Nathan Zhou","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":4,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66330,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FennekinðŸ¦Š is so cute!"},"post_url":"/t/compresser-powered-by-pdh/465118/6","custom_user_title":"FennekinðŸ¦Š is so cute!","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3378969,"name":"Domtech","username":"Domtech","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/domtech/{size}/138487_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-02T19:16:53.832Z","cooked":"
NathanZhou:

So if youâ€™re running say 5 independent solenoid channel, you would be needing 5 relay

An h-bridge relay can actually control two solenoid channels (or one double solenoid)

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-05-02T19:16:53.832Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":52,"readers_count":51,"score":15.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":465118,"topic_slug":"compresser-powered-by-pdh","display_username":"Domtech","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14045,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robototes Lead Mech Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/compresser-powered-by-pdh/465118/7","custom_user_title":"Robototes Lead Mech Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3378976,"name":"Nathan Zhou","username":"NathanZhou","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathanzhou/{size}/225374_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-02T19:19:32.677Z","cooked":"

but i donâ€™t think you could do that with SPIKE relay. as do so might require connecting ground directly to power which might be against

R625 *Donâ€™t modify critical power paths.

CUSTOM CIRCUITS shall not directly alter the power pathways between the ROBOT battery, PDP/PDH, motor controllers, relays (per R504-B), motors and actuators (per R501), pneumatic solenoid valves, or other elements of the ROBOT control system (items explicitly mentioned in R710). Custom high impedance voltage monitoring or low impedance current monitoring circuitry connected to the ROBOTâ€™S electrical system is acceptable, if the effect on the ROBOT outputs is inconsequential.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-05-02T19:19:32.677Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":51,"readers_count":50,"score":15.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":465118,"topic_slug":"compresser-powered-by-pdh","display_username":"Nathan Zhou","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":14045,"username":"Domtech","name":"Domtech","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/domtech/{size}/138487_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66330,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FennekinðŸ¦Š is so cute!"},"post_url":"/t/compresser-powered-by-pdh/465118/8","custom_user_title":"FennekinðŸ¦Š is so cute!","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3378980,"name":"Gavin Matthews","username":"bovlb","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bovlb/{size}/167232_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-02T19:25:00.986Z","cooked":"
username2:

So on the robot my team made back in 2023 we powered the compressor off the pdh after we blew a couple fuses and an inspector told us to do that.

While this may be legal with certain additional hardware and some software changes, I suspect that what the inspector meant was that the PCM/PH be powered from a 20A breaker on the PDH rather than a 20A fused channel.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-05-02T19:25:00.986Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":43,"readers_count":42,"score":13.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":465118,"topic_slug":"compresser-powered-by-pdh","display_username":"Gavin Matthews","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38743,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming mentor, Team 2102, RI, CSA (he/him)"},"post_url":"/t/compresser-powered-by-pdh/465118/9","custom_user_title":"Programming mentor, Team 2102, RI, CSA (he/him)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3378981,"name":"Domtech","username":"Domtech","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/domtech/{size}/138487_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-02T19:27:06.883Z","cooked":"

I donâ€™t think tying the ground of the solenoids to the ground of the spike is a violation of that rule as is does not modify the power pathway.

Itâ€™s been a long time since Iâ€™ve seen it done that way, but it used to a common way of controlling solenoids and LEDs.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-05-02T19:27:06.883Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":41,"readers_count":40,"score":8.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":465118,"topic_slug":"compresser-powered-by-pdh","display_username":"Domtech","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":66330,"username":"NathanZhou","name":"Nathan Zhou","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathanzhou/{size}/225374_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14045,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robototes Lead Mech Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/compresser-powered-by-pdh/465118/10","custom_user_title":"Robototes Lead Mech Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3378982,"name":"Nathan Zhou","username":"NathanZhou","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathanzhou/{size}/225374_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-02T19:30:01.870Z","cooked":"

Correct. Per

R621 *Protect circuits with appropriate circuit breakers

and

R617 *Power radio as specified â€“ Part 2. The device supplying power to the wireless bridge per R616 must be connected to either:
A. the designated supply terminals at the end of the PDP, as shown in Figure 8-13. With the
exception of a single CTR Electronics Pneumatics Control Module (PCM, P/N am-2858) or REV
Robotics Pneumatic Hub (PH, P/N REV-11-1852), no other electrical load shall be connected to
these PDP terminals.

Relay is not PCM or PH. so it can only be connected to regular breaker channel.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-05-02T19:31:35.510Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":38,"readers_count":37,"score":12.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":465118,"topic_slug":"compresser-powered-by-pdh","display_username":"Nathan Zhou","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":38743,"username":"bovlb","name":"Gavin Matthews","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bovlb/{size}/167232_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66330,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FennekinðŸ¦Š is so cute!"},"post_url":"/t/compresser-powered-by-pdh/465118/11","custom_user_title":"FennekinðŸ¦Š is so cute!","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3378991,"name":"Gavin Matthews","username":"bovlb","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bovlb/{size}/167232_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-02T19:37:25.781Z","cooked":"

No, that wasnâ€™t what I meant at all.

There was no mention of a relay in the original post. OP made it sound as if they initially had it wired correctly with the PH on a fused channel, and then simply moved the compressor onto a breaker, leaving the pressure switch on the PH. This would not be legal or safe.

Itâ€™s a common practice to use a self-resetting 20A breaker for the PCM/PH with compressor instead of a 20A fuse. No (additional) relays involved.

Ok I get it.

You canâ€™t have a compressor wired directly to PDP and have it just running when the robot is powered on.

You canâ€™t have a compressor wired directly to PDP, unplug the breaker during the competition so itâ€™s not running but insert the breaker before the match for refilling air into the system.

What you can do if your fuse keep popping for PCM/VRM port is move your PCM to a regular PDP channel wchich use a max 20A self resetting breaker.

","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-05-02T19:56:16.412Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":35,"readers_count":34,"score":12.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":465118,"topic_slug":"compresser-powered-by-pdh","display_username":"donald","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66477,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/compresser-powered-by-pdh/465118/14","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3379027,"name":"Gavin Matthews","username":"bovlb","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bovlb/{size}/167232_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-02T20:05:25.110Z","cooked":"

The effect of a pressure switch connected to the PH is to control the compressor output on the PH. If nothing is connected to the compressor output on the PH, then a PH-connected pressure switch will have no effect. A compressor connected directly to the PDH will simply be on while the robot is powered.

R807 says that the stored air pressure must be no greater than 120psi, and there are two independent mechanisms to ensure that. The primary mechanism is the pressure switch controlling the compressor. The backup mechanism is the pressure relief valve calibrated to no more than 125 psi (R811). You have to have both.

If you connect the compressor directly to the PDH, then hopefully you have the pressure relief value exhausting throughout the match, as the alternative is that your storage pressure can become dangerously high.

As I said above, I suspect that the RIâ€™s suggestion was merely to move the PH power from a fuse to a self-resetting breaker. This means that if it goes overcurrent then it will still pop, but then it will start working again shortly after.
